description.narrative: (Philippines): Basa Pilipinas (Read, Philippines) is implemented in close coordination with the Philippine Department of Education. It contributes to USAID's goal of improving the reading skills of children by building the capacity of the Philippine government to promote early-grade reading, institutionalizing programs for struggling readers, and developing and distributing age-appropriate reading materials. FY 2017 funds will be used to train teachers on basic approaches to early-grade literacy; develop, procure, and distribute teaching and kindergarten learning materials; pilot an intensive program targeting students with reading challenges; develop an online learning course for teachers; design and implement a simplified classroom observation literacy tool; conduct an early-grade reading assessment data collection and analysis in Filipino and English; and further research to better understand the trajectory of reading achievement by gender.
